docs.lead_paragraph: Admit it: Now and then you call in sick because of job stress but tell your boss you've got the flu. That alibi doesn't work so well, however, for people who are so overwhelmed by workplace anxieties that they need days or weeks to recuperate, and who must often apply for workers' compensation to cover their absence. According to the Bureau of Labor Statistics, victims of occupational stress -- or neurotic reaction to stress, in the agency's terminology -- stayed out a median of 23 days in 1997, compared with 5 days for all injuries and illnesses.

docs.lead_paragraph: Nearly a decade after New York City first flirted with the idea of requiring its Medicaid recipients to join managed care plans, the first several thousand people identified for a mandatory program have finally been enrolled, officials said yesterday. The enrollment by the 4,688 recipients in New York City is part of the first phase of a three-year effort to force all of the city's 1.1 million Medicaid clients into health maintenance organizations -- the largest Medicaid managed care program in the country. In addition, about 375,000 city Medicaid recipients have voluntarily enrolled in managed care plans since 1991.
